example:
A: Yo, is this place open today?
B: Yeah, we’re open till 10 PM. 
A: Bet. I’ll stop by in a bit.
B: Sounds good, see ya then.
A: Make sure you got those bagels ready.
B: You already know, we stacked.

A: The L train is delayed again.
B: Figures. It’s always something with that train.
A: Real talk, I’m gonna be late for work.
B: Deadass? Just tell them the MTA trippin'.
A: I already did, they don't even care anymore.
B: It is what it is, man.

A: You coming to the party tonight?
B: Duh! I wouldn't miss it for the world.
A: Word. It's gonna be a movie.
B: You already know. Who else is coming?
A: Everybody. It's gonna be packed.
B: Say less, I'm already there.

meaning: 사춘기 같은 한때야. (시간이 지나면 괜찮아질 거야)
example:
A: My brother is acting so weird lately.
B: He's probably just going through a phase.
A: He cut his hair and started listening to weird music.
B: Sounds like typical teen angst to me.
A: I hope he grows out of it soon.
B: He will, don't even trip.

meaning: 철들면 나아질 거야. (나이가 들면 그만둘 거야)
example:
A: Does he still throw tantrums?
B: Nah, he’ll grow out of it eventually.
A: I used to be like that when I was a kid.
B: Same, but we all find our way.
A: Now I'm just tired all the time.
B: Facts, adulting is hard out here.

A: The audience was hyped during the concert.
B: No cap, the energy was crazy.
A: I felt like a rockstar on that stage.
B: You were vibing hard, for real.
A: Next time we need a bigger venue.
B: Facts, we're definitely outgrowing this spot.

A: That guy is such a leech, always asking for money.
B: Deadass, he never pays anyone back.
A: I'm done letting him crash at my place.
B: About time, he was straight mooching.
A: He's gonna be mad though.
B: Let him be mad, protect your peace.

A: Yo, don't go out without a coat. It’s freezing out!
B: Is it really that bad?
A: It’s brick outside, deadass.
B: My bad, I'll grab my puffer.
A: Good move, you'll thank me later.
B: Word, I'm not tryna be an icicle.

A: The plot of this show is so intriguing.
B: Facts, I'm totally hooked.
A: I didn't see that twist coming at all.
B: Straight fascinating, I'm telling you.
A: We gotta binge the whole season.
B: Say less, I'm down for it.

meaning: 많은 생각을 하게 만드네. (깊은 영감을 줘)
example:
A: That documentary was really thought provoking.
B: It made me rethink a lot of things, lowkey.
A: Especially the part about social media.
B: Facts, it's actually kinda scary.
A: We should talk about it more later.
B: For sure, that's a deep convo right there.

meaning: 우리 알고 지낸 지 엄청 오래됐어.
example:
A: Yo, how do you know Mike?
B: Mike? Man, we go way back.
A: For real? I didn't know you guys were like that.
B: Facts, we were in the same sandbox, deadass.
A: That's crazy, he's a real one.
B: You already know, that's my day one.

similar: Reminds me of the old days.
example:
A: Remember this song? It was everywhere in 2010.
B: Oh man, it takes me back to high school.
A: Facts, we used to blast this in the car.
B: Lowkey missing those vibes right now.
A: Same, life was so much simpler then.
B: Real talk, we were just chilling.

A: Hi, I'm here for my appointment.
B: Word, just fill out this form real quick.
A: Do I need to sign the back too?
B: Yeah, make sure you hit every line.
A: Got it, I'll bring it back in a sec.
B: Take your time, no rush.

meaning: 전혀 기억이 안 나는데. (들어본 적 없어)
example:
A: Do you remember that guy from the party?
B: Honestly, it doesn't ring a bell.
A: You know, the one with the bright red hair.
B: Deadass? Still nothing, my bad.
A: He was tryna be a DJ or something.
B: Everyone tryna be a DJ these days, for real.

primary: He called off the project. That's music to my ears. I was already spread too thin
meaning: 그가 프로젝트 취소했대. 완전 소식이지! 나 이미 감당하기 힘들었거든.
example:

B: Deadass? That's music to my ears!
A: I knew you'd be happy, you were stressed.
B: Real talk, I was already spread too thin.
A: Now you can finally catch a break.
B: Facts, I'm about to go home and sleep.

meaning: 커피 한 잔 마시면 딱 좋겠다.
example:

B: Same, I'm tryna stay awake here.
A: Down for a Starbucks run?
B: Say less, I'm already grabbing my keys.

B: You already know, extra shot, no cap.

B: I'm telling you, I'm on a roll.
A: No cap, you're really crushing it lately.
B: Just tryna get that bag, you know?
A: Keep that same energy all week.
B: For real, I'm locked in now.

A: What happened with that apartment?
B: Man, the deal fell through at the last sec.
A: No way! What went wrong?
B: Some issues with the landlord, deadass.
A: That sucks, I'm sorry to hear that.
B: It is what it is, on to the next one.

meaning: 남들한테 말하기 창피하지만 좋아하는 게 뭐야?
example:

B: Honestly? I'm obsessed with reality TV.

B: They can judge all they want, no cap.

B: Duh, it's my cheat day!
A: No cap, that looks fire though.
B: You want a slice? I'm sharing.
A: I shouldn't, but I'm tryna vibe.
B: Say less, take two.

primary: For lack of a better word
meaning: 적당한 말이 안 떠올라서 그러는데. (마땅한 표현이 없네)
similar: For lack of a better term.
example:
A: He's just... for lack of a better word, a hater.
B: Deadass, he always got something negative to say.
A: Lowkey, it's exhausting being around him.
B: Facts, you gotta distance yourself from that energy.
A: I'm already on it, no cap.
B: Smart move, protect your peace.

A: Man, I didn't get the job.
B: It is what it is, man. Something better's coming.
A: I really thought I had it in the bag.
B: No cap, but everything happens for a reason.
A: You right, I'm just gonna keep pushing.
B: That's the spirit, don't even trip.

A: How was the interview?
B: Good, they asked about my experience right off the bat.
A: Word, they didn't waste any time then.
B: Facts, it was straight to business.
A: I hope you nailed it though.
B: Honestly, I think I did, for real.

A: Yo, you and Sara are still close?
B: Facts, she's been my best friend from day one.
A: That's real loyalty right there.
B: You already know, she's stuck with me through everything.
A: Wish I had a friend like that.
B: You'll find your people, no cap.

meaning: 나중에 후회하는 것보다 조심하는 게 낫지.
example:

B: Better safe than sorry, the forecast said rain later.
A: I guess, but it looks clear to me.
B: Famous last words before getting soaked, deadass.
A: Fine, I'll grab mine too just in case.
B: Smart move, you'll thank me later.

meaning: 가만히 있는 것보다 뭐라도 하는 게 낫지.
example:

B: Better moving than not, at least we're learning.

B: Say less, I'm already locked in.

primary: You can never be too careful
example:

B: Yeah, you can never be too careful in this neighborhood.
A: Deadass, I heard about that break-in last week.

A: I knew you'd love it, they got some fire jerseys.
B: Say less, we going today?
A: For sure, I need some new fits too.

B: No cap, he’s got that natural charisma.

B: Deadass, the allergy season is trippin' right now.
A: For real, my eyes are so itchy.
B: Take a Claritin and chill, no cap.

primary: I have a hunch, gut feeling
meaning: 내 직감이 그래. (왠지 그럴 것 같아)
example:

B: Honestly? I have a hunch they might pull it off.
A: No cap? The odds are totally against them.
B: Facts, but my gut feeling says otherwise.
A: I'll put some money on them then.
B: Bet, let's see what happens.

primary:
Just go with your gut
What does your gut say?
meaning: 그냥 네 직감을 믿어봐. 네 직감은 뭐라고 해?
example:

B: Just go with your gut, for real.
A: But the pay is better at the other one.
B: What does your gut say though? Which vibe is better?
A: Honestly, the creative one feels more like me.
B: There you go. Always vibe with your gut, no cap.

primary: Spot on, on the spot, put someone on the spot
example:
A: Your analysis of the situation was spot on.
B: Thanks, I spent a lot of time on it.
A: Sorry for putting you on the spot in the meeting though.
B: Nah, it's all good. I was ready for it.

B: That's real loyalty, no cap.
A: He's always had my back through everything.
B: Real ones are hard to find in the city.

primary:
Run some errands
Hit the road
Get it together
Keep it together
Put it together
Have a blast
Cut it out
meaning: 볼일 좀 보다, 출발하다, 정신 좀 차려, 마침내 해내다, 즐거운 시간 보내, 그만 좀 해!
example:

B: Take your time, but we gotta get it together if we wanna beat traffic.
A: Word, I'm tryna put it together as fast as I can.
B: Just keep it together, man. Don't stress.
A: Cut it out with the pressure! I'm moving.
B: Fine, just tryna make sure we have a blast tonight.

meaning: 너 이제 가는 게 좋겠어. (늦기 전에 가봐)
example:
A: It's getting late, you'd better be off.
B: Facts, I didn't realize it was already midnight.
A: Be safe getting home, the subways are trippin'.
B: You already know, I'm calling an Uber.

B: For sure, stay safe.

A: You look like a zombie, what happened?
B: Man, I had trouble sleeping last night.

B: Facts, I couldn't stop thinking about that deadline.

A: Thanks for the help, man.
B: Any time. Have a good one!

B: Word, I'll catch you on the flip side.

B: Peace.

A: How was the party last night?
B: Yo, I had a blast! It was too lit.
A: I knew it was gonna be a whole movie.
B: Facts, the music was fire and the crowd was hyped.
A: Wish I could've made it.
B: Next time for sure, no cap.

B: Facts, the city is acting up today.
A: Guess I'll just order something on Uber Eats.
B: Best bet, no cap.

B: Dunno, he was tryna hit the gym earlier.

B: Nah, he just bailed around noon.
A: I'll just shoot him a text.
B: Word, let me know if he hits you back.

B: Man, my heart skipped a beat! That was too close.
A: Deadass, some people really don't know how to drive.
B: For real, I'm still shaking a little.
A: Take a deep breath, we're good now.
B: Facts, I need to chill for a sec.

meaning: 여자애들이란... (이해할 수 없는 행동을 할 때)
example:

B: Nah, I'm tryna vibe here. Let's just put our names down.

B: You already know, I'm tryna look out for my homies.

example:

B: Honestly, it's warm for November. I'm vibing.

B: It's good for the price, but not the best in the city.
A: No cap? I heard people hyping it up.
B: It's alright, but you get what you pay for, deadass.
A: I'll probably just stick to our usual spot then.
B: Smart move, nothing beats a classic.

A: Did I just say that out loud?
B: Yeah, you said you were tryna quit your job, deadass.
A: My bad, I was just thinking too hard.
B: Facts, you better watch what you say around here.
A: No cap, I don't want the boss catching those vibes.
B: For real, stay lowkey for now.

meaning: 그냥 내 생각을 입 밖으로 내본 거야. (혼잣말이야)
example:
A: Wait, did you say we should move to Brooklyn?
B: Oh, I'm just thinking out loud. Don't take it too seriously.
A: Lowkey, it's not a bad idea though.
B: Facts, the vibes in Bushwick are immaculate.
A: We should definitely look into it later.
B: For sure, let's keep that on the table.

meaning: 한번 고려해 보다. (생각해 볼 가치가 있어)
example:
A: Yo, you ever thought about starting a podcast?
B: I've entertained the idea a few times, for real.

A: We could just start small and see how it goes.
B: Facts, I'm down to entertain that, say less.

B: Honestly, you get a lot of bang for your buck with that camera.

B: For real, it's almost a pro tool now.

B: Say less, I'm coming with you.

A: How's that cold brew?
B: Man, it hits the spot. Best thing all morning.

B: Man, this build up is crazy! I'm hyped.

B: The anticipation is killing me, for real.

B: Oh my god, that beat is straight fire!

A: You've been staring at that wall for five minutes.
B: Oh, sorry. I'm just deep in thought.

B: Honestly, I'm just stressed about the move, deadass.
A: Don't trip, we got this handled together.
B: Facts, I appreciate you looking out.

B: I'm just tired of the MTA always trippin', man.
A: Don't get worked up, it is what it is.
B: I know, but it happens every single day, for real.
A: Take a breath, we'll get there eventually.
B: Facts, I'm just tryna maintain my peace.

primary: Oh great, it is what it is
meaning: 하, 참나. 어쩌겠어, 이게 인생이지. (풍자적인 체념)
example:

B: Oh great. Well, it is what it is.

B: Say less, I'll pay for the next round if that happens.

meaning: 도대체 왜 이렇게 늦어지는 거야? (무슨 일 있어?)
example:
A: The line hasn't moved for 10 minutes. What's the holdup?
B: Dunno, maybe the system went down or something.
A: This is crazy, I'm tryna get my coffee and bounce.

B: I'm tryna, but this test is stressing me out, deadass.
A: Don't even trip, you studied hard enough.
B: Facts, I just need to clear my head for a bit.

B: Say less, I'm starving.

example:

B: Snacks, drinks, electronics... you name it, they got it.

B: Preciate it, I was lowkey nervous about the color combo.
A: Nah, it's straight fire. You look like a whole influencer.
B: Deadass? Thanks, man.
A: For real, you got that confidence, no cap.
B: You already know, I'm tryna stay fly.

primary: Thank you, you made my day
meaning: 정말 고마워요. 덕분에 기분이 너무 좋아졌어요.
example:

B: Oh my god, thank you! You made my day.

B: Facts, this is exactly what I needed to keep going.

A: Apparently not, it was straight drama.

meaning: 나는 약속은 꼭 지켜. (확고한 결심을 했어 - 맥락상 특정 목표에 대한 헌신)

primary: Every cloud has a silver lining.
meaning: 개구멍에도 볕들 날 있다. (나쁜 일 뒤에는 좋은 일이 생겨요)
example:

B: Don't trip, every cloud has a silver lining. Maybe something better will happen.

B: Facts, but at least you saved some money for the next one.
A: True, I'm tryna stay positive, no cap.
B: That's the spirit, keep your head up.

B: Facts, but the silver lining is we can finally check out that indoor gallery.
A: Oh true, I've been wanting to go there, deadass.
B: See? It worked out in the end.
A: You always find the vibe, no cap.
B: Tryna keep it positive, always.

meaning: 나 지금 기세가 좋아! (연달아 성공하고 있어)
example:
A: Yo, you just finished another project?
B: Facts, I'm on a roll this week.
A: No cap, you're really crushing the game lately.
B: Just tryna keep the momentum going, you know?
A: Keep that same energy, for real.
B: Locked in and ready for the next one.

primary: I was spread too thin, I was in way over my head
meaning: 감당하기 힘들 정도로 일을 많이 벌였었어. 내가 감당할 수 있는 수준을 넘어섰지.
similar: Bitten off more than I could chew.
example:

B: Lowkey, I was spread too thin and in way over my head.
A: Facts, you were juggling like three jobs, deadass.

B: Facts, your input really helped vibe the whole thing up.
A: Let's show the client and see what they think.
B: Say less, I'm hitting send right now.

A: What is he doing over there?
B: Just jerking off instead of actually working, deadass.
A: Facts, he’s been on his phone for an hour.
B: For real, if the boss sees him, he's cooked.
A: Should we say something?
B: Nah, let him figure it out on his own.

meaning: 그는 너를 기만할 거야. 너를 가지고 놀 거야. (속이다 혹은 헛된 기대를 주다)
example:
A: He said he'd help me with the promotion.
B: Don't trust him, he will just jerk you off and never do it.

B: Facts, he’s a straight-up silver-tongued snake.
A: I guess I'll just handle it myself then.
B: Smart move, don't let him play you.

B: Yeah, I'm around. You tryna link up?
A: Facts, I'm near Union Square right now.
B: Oh word? I'm like 5 blocks away.
A: Say less, come meet me at the park.

meaning: 내가 네 뒤를 봐줄게. (내가 있잖아, 걱정 마)
example:
A: I'm lowkey nervous about this presentation.
B: Don't trip, I got your back if you get stuck.
